ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And companions with big beautiful eyes
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and there shall be wide-eyed maidens,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will have maidens with large, lovely black and white eyes,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And (there will be) Hur with wide lovely eyes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And (there are) fair ones with wide, lovely eyes,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and fair maidens with large, lustrous eyes
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And there will be fair ones large eyed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And (there will be) Companions with beautiful, big, and lustrous eyes,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (there will be) Houris (fair females) with wide, lovely eyes (as wives for the pious),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [for them are] fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:22] and houris, maidens with intensely black eyes [set] against the whiteness [of their irises], with wide eyes (‘īn: the ‘ayn here is inflected with a kasra instead of a damma because it [the kasra] better harmonises with the yā’; the singular is ‘aynā’, similar [in pattern] to hamrā’; a variant reading [for wa-hūrun ‘īn] has the genitive case wa-hūrin ‘īn)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And (there are) fair ones with wide, lovely eyes,
